Wisdom: خُذِ الْحِكْمَةَ أَنَّى كَانَتْ فَإِنَّ الْحِكْمَةَ ضَالَّةُ كُلِّ مُؤْمِنٍ
enWisdom: Take wisdom from wherever it may be, for verily wisdom is the lost property of every believer

Wisdom: خُذِ الْحِكْمَةَ مِمَّنْ أَتَاكَ بِهَا وَانْظُرْ إِلَى مَا قَالَ وَلَا تَنْظُرْهُ إِلَى مَنْ قَالَ
enWisdom: Take wisdom from the one who brings it to you, and look at what he is said and do not look at who said it

Wisdom: الْحِكْمَةُ ضَالَّةُ كُلِّ مُؤْمِنٍ فَخُذُوهَا وَلَوْ مِنْ أَفْوَاهِ الْمُنَافِقِينَ
enWisdom: Wisdom is the lost property of every believer, so take it even if it be from the mouths of hypocrites

Wisdom: آلَّةُ الْحَكِيمِ الْحِكْمَةُ فَهُوَ يَطْلُبُهَا حَيْثُ‏ كَانَتْ
enWisdom: The lost possession of a sage is wisdom, so he seeks it out wherever it may be

Wisdom: ضَالَّةُ الْعَاقِلِ الْحِكْمَةُ فَهُوَ أَحَقُّ بِهَا حَيْثُ كَانَتْ
enWisdom: The lost possession of an intelligent person is wisdom, so he is more entitled to it wherever it may be
